## Adding to the lab book
Adding to the lab book is very easy.

### Option 1: non-computational
1. Go to the [lab-book]() repository on the dropbox.
2. Make and save the relevant changes to the .Rmd file in question
   + There is one .Rmd file per chapter.
3. Email Julie Avishay & Mike so that one of them can submit the edit.

### Option 2: computational
Note: this will only work for those whose Github users have been added to the book repository.

1. Go to the lab-book repository
   + *either* the [lab-book]() repository on the dropbox,
   + *or* your local clone of the repository.
        + to clone the repository: `git clone https://github.com/jlaffy/lab-book.git`  
2. Make and save the relevant changes to the .Rmd file in question.
   + There is one .Rmd file per chapter.
3. `git commit -am <myShortMessage>`
   + where <myShortMessage> is for example 'fixed typo'
4. `git pull origin master`
5. `git push origin master`
